trans-unit.source: Contains methods that return information about worker processes.
The <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo> class is not meant to be instantiated in your own code.

Use the static <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetCurrentProcessInfo%2A> and <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetHistory%2A> methods to populate <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo> objects, and then use the properties of the <xref:System.Web.ProcessInfo> objects to obtain information about the processes.

The <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetCurrentProcessInfo%2A> and <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetHistory%2A> methods can be used only with Microsoft Internet Information Services (IIS) version 5.0 on Microsoft Windows 2000 and Windows XP or with IIS 6.0 on Windows Server 2003 and using IIS 5.0 isolation mode.
For more information, see [NIB: How to: Configure ASP.NET Applications for an ASP.NET Version](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/3e2037d2-61aa-44f3-b84e-d4dab3572ad3).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.ProcessModelInfo"></xref> class.
Returns information about the worker process that is executing the current request.
The <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetCurrentProcessInfo%2A> method is applicable only for applications that are running under the ASP.NET process model.
A <xref href="System.Web.ProcessInfo"></xref> that contains information about the current process.
Process information is not available for the current request.
Returns information about recent worker processes.
The <xref:System.Web.ProcessModelInfo.GetHistory%2A> method is applicable only for applications that are running under the ASP.NET process model.
The number of processes for which information is requested.
An array of the most recent objects (up to 100); otherwise, if the number of available objects is less than numRecords, all available objects.
